one_reviews_text: I've always wanted to try VR and finally sprung for the Quest 2. What is bad is that you need to use a Facebook account to set it up. There are a lot of games for the Q2 that range from free to fifty bucks. There are some free apps that are not interactive but very interesting, like a tour of the White House and a tour of the International Space Station in 360°. Or get a close up look at dinosaurs. Several free games are available, as well. My wife likes to fish with Bait. You may want to opt for an upgraded head strap as the included strap can be a little difficult to adjust, especially if you share the headset with another person.My wife says the screen is very sharp, but I've never been able to get it more than moderately sharp. My glasses do not fit well in the headset. The headset is kind of heavy. I wish I could compare this with the PlayStation VR. You may want to borrow your friend's Quest 2 if you get motion sickness easily to see if VR is for you.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 May 2022

one_reviews_text: A truly mesmerizing thing to behold. So much functionality and content in such a little thing, one look at the quest 2 and you’re itching your brain at how so much fits into there. To hold out your arm in a virtual world and see your arm stretch out digitally is unreal! Playing with a friend just adds icing to the cake for me, and even playing social games is quite entertaining. With the ability to watch movies, in a large virtual movie theater like you’re at a real cinema will never make you go to a theater again. Exercise, watch videos or movies, play terrifying or hilariously fun games, it’s all in the palm of your hands. You can even go somewhere far away, my choice was going to see the northern lights. Although for play it’s also a tool for work if need be, as there are free apps to download that can help your work life in any way. There are so many other functions I couldn’t possibly fit in this review. However I will add this: I received my headset and had faulty lenses that were blurry as hell, and had a replacement come that gave me the experience I paid for. Keep in mind that statement as it can happen to you as well, my replacement took about a week I believe and even came earlier than the tracker said.If you’re thinking about it..get it, trust me you’ll have a smile glued to your face the first second you see your virtual reality hands.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 March 2022
review_title: You get what you pay for!!

one_reviews_text: The headset itself is not bad.  As other reviews have stated, you'll almost certainly want to get an upgraded strap and maybe a battery pack.  If you wear glassed you'll need to buy lens protectors since for some reason the Quest 2 (unlike previous models), does not include them.The REAL negatives are Facebook related.  I have an FB account but I am not a big FB user.  I managed to have some fun for about two hours, after which the account link cause a verification lock on my Facebook profile.  Since Oculus forces account integration, losing access to FB means losing access to Oculus, purchases, settings, account, etc..  And since there is no Facebook support in existence anymore, not even Oculus support will do a damn thing to help you (I was told that even though they are both Meta, they apparently have no communication with each other).And so now I need to refute all my Oculus purchases via my credit card.  Rather than starting everything from scratch, I'm returning this dud until I find a better, non Meta, option.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 May 2022
review_title: If you're not a Facebook fanboy you're gonna have a bad time.

one_reviews_text: This hot steamy pile of Zuckerberg trash is a nightmare to deal with. Kids got it for Christmas and inadvertently put in a lock code on it. Now following Marks trash instructions I can not get The Crapulus to reset following the just as equally bad app’s pathetic directions. Since I bought this in early November It does t appear I can return this turd since it was purchased over 45 days ago. Marks BFF Bezos is laughing all the way to the bank on this cheap junk.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2021

one_reviews_text: I understand that this may just be my individual experience with my individual headset- but from day one, all I experienced with this thing was frustration. Firstly- they fail to tell you that you can’t use Oculus Link to play through your PC unless you have one of a very specific list of supported graphics cards, which is the main thing that I bought it for. I decided I could get over that and just use it as a standalone unit- then I noticed this strange green streak on the left lens. At first I thought it was a graphics error, but it persisted after several attempts to troubleshoot with Oculus support and to clean the lens. I received a partial refund for the defect from Amazon, and again decided that I could settle. About two weeks into my usage of the product, it would load into the blue “M” screen- then get stuck on the “…” screen while it played the main menu music and made sounds as I pointed the controllers around. The display was clearly stuck for some reason. I factory reset the device several times to try and fix this issue but it stayed on the “…” screen. At this point I threw my hands up and returned it all together. Extremely underwhelming and frustrating experience- it really felt like I was beta-testing an unfinished product that I payed full price for.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 May 2022

one_reviews_text: I bought this a few months ago and I can’t imagine going back to anything other than VR. That being said, this definitely needs a battery pack b/c it burns through charge. You get 2 hours max of play time regardless of what you’re doing. I bought the elite strap battery pack and that gives 2 hours exactly extra totaling a max of 4 hours. I think I’d prefer my own battery pack in hindsight to get more time but it’s easy to spend too much time playing. The second issue is memory. This works great for starters but it’s surprisingly easy to use everything. I have uninstalled games I already played so that I can play others. Unfortunately you can’t up the memory so you have to buy a whole different headset to bump up. Thirdly, I suggest using an anti-microbial spray for the foam face padding like the cpap cleaner sprays. It’s easy to sweat in these and the silicone makes horrible marks on my skin so cleaning it is best to stop break outs. But if you worry about breakdown then silicone covers are great.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 15 March 2022

one_reviews_text: The experience of a VR headset itself is great! I love what is capable of and using it, I have a pretty small player space but even so, I have been able to enjoy various games with the Quest 2 and the link cable.ABOUT JOYSTICK DRIFT:I am deeply concerned about the durability of the analog joysticks on the controllers, I have used this product for less than 20 DAYS, most of my playtime is Beat Saber (which does not even use the analog stick) and then around 10 to 15 combined hours of Pavlov and HL Alyx.It was while playing HL Alyx that I started noticing that sometimes my character was sometimes randomly moving to the right when I pushed the stick forward, initially I thought it was due to a faulty link connection, but I checked in the software calibration the joysticks, and surprise surprise: Joystick drift on the left controller. But not any kind of drift, it pulls hard to the right whenever I push left, so it's IMPOSSIBLE to go left on continuous movement games, and it sometimes pulls right when I am moving forward. This type of stick drift will NOT be diminished by software calibration sadly.I could claim the warranty right now, but apparently I have to ship the ENTIRE Oculus back and Amazon won't pay shipping fees because I have shipped the product outside the US. Meaning that it's probably cheaper (in time and money) to buy an entirely NEW left controller for $69 from the Oculus store and get it shipped than paying shipping fees, being out of an Oculus for god knows how long (According to other users they take somewhere between 2 and 8 WEEKS or longer to get the product back), set it all up once again, and all of that hassle just to most likely, as said by other Oculus owners, get a REFURBISHED controller back.I feel SCAMMED regarding this, but your mileage may vary as I have seen other users with controllers lasting for about 1.5 to 2 years without developing issues, seems like I just got a DEFECTIVE PRODUCT, one that apparently I just have to deal with now. The only reason I would give 2 stars is that, even if I got a defective controller, the experience has been amazing, which kind of saddens me and makes me give it 1 star because I really looked forward to using my headset more often, which will now be an awful experience thanks to the stick drift.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 February 2022
review_title: Left controller developed horrible drift after less than 20 DAYS of use

one_reviews_text: Great gift for the family,  its so awesome the graphics are pretty cool and the games are great !
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 December 2021

one_reviews_text: Got a humble bundle with a few VR games and this seemed to be a popular headset. So far I'm not overly impressed with the setup but will try it. I have the games in steam and don't want to spend $30 to have virtual desktop. That being said Airlink has been a challenge to set up so far and I feel for anyone who is non technical trying to set this up to work with steam. Will update my review once/if I get it working.I managed to kind of get it working sometimes but you have to uninstall and re-install the PC Quest app in order to get the device to pair with AirLink. Seems like I can't just put the headset on and play, I have to spend an hour removing and re-adding the device, removing and re-adding the software, rebooting systems that are completely fine otherwise. Even the hardwire I tried tonight did not work as expected. Seriously considering returning the unit. The only reason I run out of battery so far is spending an hour removing and putting it back on trying to get it to talk to the PC in any way.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 March 2022

one_reviews_text: I had the Quest 1 for a year before buying this one. While the display itself is a bit lower quality (read about that online) the extra rendering quality makes the overall experience superior. I see things in Onward that I did not see in the Quest 1.The lighter weight is a plus. The new hand controls have a different feel; I think they are not as comfortable as the Quest 1 controllers. I've gotten used to them now.One downside is that the power cord is only a foot long. If I want to play when the battery is running out I can't do it. So, if you have a Quest 1, save that long cord and when you pass on your Quest 1 to someone else, give them the shorter cord.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 November 2021

No customer support online.After hours and many restarts and reviewing  YouTube videos it half works. Slow to load and forces a Facebook account.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 November 2021
review_title: Zero customer support. Doesn’t work out of the box

one_reviews_text: I’ve always wanted VR tech but was always held back with reports of problems with the tech and cost barrier with having to own an expensive gaming PC. I am happy to say that the Quest 2 is the first mainstream and modern VR that is an all in one standalone.I am very impressed with it. From all the features it has including the high resolution screens, comfort, and speakers. The software was much more advanced than expected. I feel like there is so much potential for this tech. Once people try it out they will want to have it. It has many applications for entertainment and real world. I think Oculus is the only main competitor right now and is doing a great job so far. I am curious to see what Apple will bring, but they will have to work very very hard to surpass this. I think it does benefit from the open software with Android. That is a few years from now but will enjoy the Oculus until something better comes along. In the future, I’d like even high res screens, more apps available (which I think will come soon considering the recent explosion in popularity), and increased comfort and usability. It will definitely get better and am excited for the future and possibilities of it. I’d highly recommend the product. Feels like when I got my first Xbox.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 November 2021

one_reviews_text: I think for the cost, this is the best option out there. It's not super sharp, and I definitely recommend a third-party head strap attachment for comfort and clarity. I think this would be 5 stars if they included a padded head-strap and a little better resolution. Audio is pretty good. Games are fun, although really not plentiful. I love all the cool VR videos and apps that have been created, but there's not a whole lot going on yet.I think the most disappointing feature is that it's not easy to interface with Steam. But having all the data and games built in the device is pretty great.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 February 2022

one_reviews_text: I don't like the fact that you have to have a Facebook account to use this. That should be the first thing you read about these,  it's not mentioned.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 December 2021
review_title: You have to have Facebook to use this.

one_reviews_text: Purchased as a Christmas gift for my wife in 2021.  She was super surprised and not really sure what to think as she didn't have a whole lot of knowledge about the Oculus.  The unit arrived timely and as described.  She had no problem getting it up and going.  She loves playing games on it - especially fishing, ping pong and beat saber.  She uses it for her "exercise" .  Recommended.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 February 2022

one_reviews_text: The product advertises that you can simply "jump right in to vr" this is a lie. When you first boot up your oculus you are confronted by a screen telling you that you MUST download a mobile app onto some other device and pair it with your oculus in order to continue. This is trash. This is supposed to be a stand-alone device. It is still dependent on a third party device being connected. Absolute trash. Do not buy.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 December 2021

one_reviews_text: I was really looking forward to using the Oculus.  It set up with no problem and connected to WiFi and I thought they were pretty cool.My issue is that even with the glasses insert in, my glasses scratched the Oculus lenses and this was only after my first time using them, probably 1/2 hour max.  Fortunately, my regular prescription glasses were not scratched.Now, they do have third-party options like buying spacers for the lenses to prevent the lenses from being scratched by glasses and you can pay to have prescription lenses made.  However, I planned on using this with my wife who also wears glasses so prescription lenses aren't that great of an option.However, I was so turned off by this that after consulting with my wife, I decided to return them.My recommendation for anyone who wears glasses is to buy the spacers first to prevent any damage and then if desired, go the prescription route.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 February 2022

one_reviews_text: We've had an Oculus Quest for going on two years now, so I was super excited to upgrade to the new one and see how much better it was. I have to tell you...the original while heavier and hotter had a way better strap system to keep it on your head. Every time I'd go to use the Quest 2 I'd end up with a headache or my face would hurt. Trying to keep it from slipping off your face means making those fabric straps super tight, which just makes your head hurt. I finally ended up buying an elite strap (not the offical Oculus one, but a nicely padded one that hopefully won't break) just so that I could use my Quest 2 comfortably. The charging cord that's included is also super short as compared to the original Quest, no doubt so that you have to buy a longer one and spend more money. In all, while there were some improvements made from the original, they also changed things for the 2nd that made it so that you have to spend more on accessories just to be able to use it. Very disappointed in Meta.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 February 2022
review_title: Original Oculus Quest was way more comfortable

one_reviews_text: I am not a hardcore gamer. I like to play something fun from time to time, but I am too lazy and cheap to keep up with gaming tech and I absolutely hate it when I realize that my 3.5 year old laptop is too old to play something I wanna play.On the other hand I like handhelds and I have bought most of the last several big ones that have been released. I am pretty happy with handheld graphics and quality of games.All that is just the lead up to saying I like the Quest 2. Easy to get into, plenty of quality content both free and paid. I like Rec Room for free, Pop One for paid. There's evem esoteric stuff like Altspace with group therapy sessions and open mic nights. A lot to explore id you had the time.Anyway, I am happy with the purchase. Worth the money. Headset fits me well, no pain and not blurry. I dont have the elite strap and dont need it. I am just a normal guy and am happy with this.

one_reviews_text: Respecto del envió: Llego en perfecto estado (por lo que se puede apreciar) y listo para funcionar, además de que llegó antes de lo esperado.Respecto del objeto en si, ha sido bastante entretenido tanto para mi como mis padres. Es algo difícil de configurar al comienzo, y creo que a los adultos puede que les cueste más pero no hay mucho problema ya que hay mucho video tanto en español como ingles que explican como configurar algunos aspectos.Recomendaciones y avisos:Si tienes un BUEN PC y Steam (en mi caso) puedes llegar a acceder a más juegos algunos gratis incluso. Si no tienes un PC prepárate para gastar un poco de plata, ya que la tienda del Oculus la considero algo cara para mi bolsillo.Si usas lentes prepárate para sufrir un poco, vas a ver borroso pero seguirá siendo jugable xdRevisa que tu IPD (interpupillary distance) este dentro de los limites del casco que creo que es 68mm, si tu IPD es más de eso NO compres el producto, no podrás jugarlo.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 16 December 2021

one_reviews_text: I was provided with access to this Oculus Quest 2 VR by my son. He assumed I wouldn’t like it because it is VR and therefore scary. Couldn’t have been more wrong. It’s a great way to get exercise without boring machines that double as clothes racks or walking a block only to feel excruciating pain in my feet and back.Oculus comes With great programs but you can also purchase even better ones. Some of the programs such as Supernatural give you 30 days trial before billing your credit card.The Oculus is very easy to use (and I am a very stupid computer user). It has all Levels of programs and great tutorials. You can use it for exercise but there are many other other uses as well which include games, travel to amazing places, and TV. I’m even getting ready to try out a painting program.If you are going To use it for exercise but are a little leery of the price, I found it cheaper than the exercise machine/clothes racks.I definitely recommend this VR machine.

review_title: Exercise for people who have difficulty with pain and walking or machines.

one_reviews_text: The field-of-view on the Oculus Quest 2 is too narrow compared to something like the Valve Index. With the Oculus 89 degrees, you feel like you have a TV on your nose versus the true immersion you get from the valve Index with its 130 degrees. I really think the Oculus does a disservice to the VR community at large because the experience (even with current technology) can be so much better than what this product delivers.I can definitely appreciate Facebook's efforts at making a simple, easy-to-use, all-in-one product that just works out of the box. This probably makes it a good product as a general purpose novelty for use with family or friends over the holidays or something. If you actually care about VR technology and don't mind taking the time to configure a few things, the valve index will offer you a superior experience. It's not even close unfortunately.Returned.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2022
review_title: Good for a novelty experience. Bad for actual VR.

one_reviews_text: After purchasing the Oculus Quest 2, I sold my Xbox the next week. This takes gaming to a whole new level that "flat sceen" gaming can't create.It's mind blowing how immersive and fun this product is. Being able to play anywhere without cords is the future of VR and Oculus 2 does this right.There are a lot of fun games, Eleven Table Tennis, Onward (an FPS Shooter), mini golf, and loads more depending on what you are looking for.You have to experience this new level of gaming trust me. It's great.

one_reviews_text: Oculus was the company that brought us VR. They pushed hard via donations to make it a reality. They ended up bringing one of the biggest gaming minds to the mix John Carmack. Then all of a sudden facebook bought them out and all of their promises turned into lies. Like exclusive games not being a thing. Lie after lie after lie and the end result is the quest with its name changed to Meta. Basically throwing Oculus under a bus. Its hard to be happy, positive or even like this whole transition. It leaves a bad taste in everyones mouth that was involved and sadly seeing Oculus just turn into nothing is heart breaking.Glad others have picked up on the VR market because the Quest is not the way to go. I gave it 3 stars because its affordable but other than that just bad market all over it.

one_reviews_text: I love playing my games on my laptop.  Should say "loved".  I like "escape room" type games that make you use logic and reasoning to figure out solutions to puzzles, locks, etc.  I had no idea what I was getting into when I first put this thing on.  Just plain WOW.  I'm now IN the game and it's an amazing experience.  I haven't had this much fun in a while.  Would HIGHLY recommend, although I guess you have to love gaming to begin with but if you do......Cons:  You have to have a Facebook account to use.  I've heard they may change that to just being required to have an Oculus account.  Not yet though.  The headset is a little bulky.  I'm going to try a upgraded head strap to see if that helps.  Some games will take a little getting used to as far as motion sickness goes.  If you are into logic with adventure, I can't say enough about The Room and Red Matter. one_reviews_text: If you're thinking about getting an Oculus Quest 2, get an Oculus Quest 2. I wasn't really aware of it until just late last year and then received one for Christmas. After trying this for 2 weeks, with headaches and cheekbone aches all the way through, investing more time into this would have been nonsense. so I returned it, went back to Quest 1 and I have to say, I'm not missing the benefits of Quest 2 all that much.I've also tried a few facial interface, but that creates problems with smaller FOV.  the PID adjustment will not stick, wearing prescription lense mount further destroys FOV, super blurry images to the corners. in fact, the blurry images around the corners was a downgrade from Quest1 IMO.the sharper resolution didn't really do a lot for me, nor helped in sense of immersion because of those damn FOV issues, blurry corners and the general pain.I hope they decide to accommodate people with wider faces with their next revision.

review_title: built for people with narrow heads

one_reviews_text: I have absolutely enjoyed the heck out of this headset. It's fun and the fact that someone on my budget could afford it is really something. I wouldn't have had a VR set if it weren't for this being as affordable as it is. There are some shortcuts clearly taken to help keep it affordable but the actual VR hardware is amazing. Visuals are clear and immersive and it keeps up with my movements very well. If you don't have the money for something like an Index or Vive but want VR this is a great choice. It's also pretty sturdy. I've punched my table so hard my knuckles bled and the controller barely had a mark on it. You also can't tell I've headbutted my desk multiple times trying to pick up guns and rotwiener cores lol.Lets get complaints out of the way first:• The original strap the headset came with is 100% the absolute worst part of the headset.Do yourself a favor and snag the Kiwi Design head strap while you're here on Amazon. The original strap squeezed the heck out of my head and if I loosened it the headset could flop around a bit causing blurry graphics and just being uncomfortable for a different reason. Due to that constant squeeze it gave me some nasty headaches usually after 2-3 hours of gameplay but sometimes much sooner and they could last the rest of the day. While they're nothing compared to a cluster headache for pain they were still what I'd consider bad.• Air link was awesome and worked great but was broken within a week of receiving the headset likely due to a patch (0.37 I think).I didn't get to enjoy it and the only potential bit of troubleshooting I have left to try as far as I've found is a factory reset which I'm reluctant to do. I bought a 3rd party link cable which is working well enough for me but I'd really like to be able to take my gaming to my living room where I have much less risk of punching or breaking anything and have some room to physically move around.• I don't really like having to be signed in with a Facebook account.I don't think this is going to change anytime soon if ever though.I've played Hotdogs, Horseshoes, and Hand Grenades (H3VR), Blade & Sorcery, Pavlov, and Legendary Tales with my headset. I've played around 76 hours since I got it and aside from the headaches problem (which I've solved recently) it's been absolutely amazing and immersive. I've also used it to watch youtube, streaming shows, and movies. I absolutely love the thing for every use I've had for it so far. It's an absolute blast to experience actually fighting an opponent yourself whether it be that sniper in his tower or a bunch of knights. Just through the games themselves there's an amazing amount of stuff to experience but adding mods makes it even better. This headset can get your foot in the door to worlds you've always wanted to see in person at a pretty cheap price compared to it's competitors. Past video game levels, fantasy settings, all sorts of places to see and things to do.An aspect you might have been thinking about is this is a great fitness tool even without dedicated fitness apps. Before you realize it you'll be sweaty and tired from swinging your arms, moving around, and holding your arms in front of you for surprisingly long periods of time. Pretty much anything you do with your VR will involve some level of activity and the gaming will almost certainly help kick your butt into shape. You should still visit the gym and make sure you're eating right though.I have only done gaming through PCVR and SteamVR. I have not tried any of the games for the headset on it's own nor do I expect to anytime soon. If you're looking for info on them then sorry but I can't help you with that.There's several improvements I'd love to see either through future patches or future products. Probably the easiest would be the ability to verify and repair to latest patch the headset software from settings (if it's there I haven't found it). That way if my air link problem is software based I could fix it easily without having to do something like factory resetting the thing. If not then that's one more troubleshooting step I can cross off on my own fairly easily. In the next model or with an accessory if it's possible one thing I'd like is a second dedicated charge port allowing the use of a link cable and a charger with more oomph than a PC's USB 3 port would typically have for longer play times both at the same time. Another thing I'd like is a fabric cover. While the silicone cover is nice and stops the foam from irritating my face I'd love to have an official machine washable fabric facial interface cover that doesn't cost an arm and a leg.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 February 2022
review_title: Could be better in some aspects with a few changes but still absolutely worth it!

one_reviews_text: Let me say first off, I didn't realize how unfit I really am LOL this is one of the coolest things I've ever done or used in my life. Hands down. It's personally a great way to workout in your own house, and feel the full effect. I've been boxing and I can barely make through 2 rounds on hard without dying haha Climbing #2 is freaking awesome, and very interesting. The graphics are incredible, and trust me when I say that.Make sure you have enough room in your area, and know your surroundings. I already broke my sealing fan because I was trying to jump in the climb game and I hit the fan LOL. Personally, I can only go about 45 minutes to an hour and I have to take a break. It really messes with your vision so definitely be careful with that. Know your limit, and enjoy it. Games are really expensive, and hardly no free games. So budget your money on it. Definitely read reviews before purchasing anything. Other than that, it's amazing and I'm very excited to explore more. You get a ton of free videos and can explore so much! The background theme is extremely amazing! I hope this helps!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 December 2021

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest system is a great VR console for the average person. Its affordable and a new technology.I reccomend it, though I do want to note the requirements of a facebook is dangerous thing and should not be praised, even if you don't mind it. Please get a alternate account for VR if you do, and make privacy and authentification settings airtight. It is very common for personal accounts to get targeted for a plethora of reasons. Attaching a payment method to social, public media is a bad idea. Be careful.However, this review is not about the console itself, but Amazon. After receiving my package, I thought things were odd. For instance the sleeve was ripped and poorly tapped back together. The inside was also ripped. The contents, aside from the main electronics, were all over the place, unsecure. Initial thoughts were shipping was rough. However, there was more. Dust on controllers, the pull-tabs already removed and in box, and I happened to google an unboxing video. This had been unsealed and opened. I bought a new verion, from Amazon as the seller.The second thought was someone wanted to test it, maybe something happened, but it was still brand new. However, if I saw this in a store, I would look for a nicer box out of concern for quality. This is not "new" to a collector of gaming tech! This is not new to a happy child on their birthday or holiday.Upon further research to see if I was an unique case, I found a discovery: Amazon receives returned items, and often markets them as brand new. In some cases this can be fine - wrong unopened item - and I believe it's better than some companies practices of discarding the item for profit, but it is lying, untruthful, and plain scamming.I will likely be keeping this, as I'm privileged to afford this and need it for a project, and later it will be a hand-me-down for my mother. It would only be likely recycled again or just thrown out.It works perfectly. Nothing is damaged at all - its truly new! But there have been times not like my experience that other items have been found inside instead of the intended headset. I also believe that with the market how it is currently, with illness and shortages, it was likely sold at a "used" price compared to some other places. I even looked for a used one, and couldn't find one (I don't personally care for this exact system). So it's fine for me, and I can save someone else from being scammed by this system.With my newfound knowledge, however, I will not be buying things from Amazon again. I suggest you be careful also!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 January 2022

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 lost a star because it isn't big enough to fit over my glasses well, even with the larger faceplate Oculus offers, and because setting up Link to a computer takes several minutes and requires navigating the Quest 2's menus and the PC menus, which means your taking the headset on and off a couple of times. Compared to the Oculus Rift S I already owned, which connects to the PC immediately and fits my head well, it is not as friendly towards PC gaming and larger headed people with glasses.It still gets 4 stars because it's an affordable system that can be used without a decent gaming PC.If you are a PC gamer with some money and want to play VR primarily while connected to your PC, I would advice buying a different headset.If you're on a budget, don't have a gaming PC, and/or don't have a large head or wide glasses, Quest 2 is a  good choice and will save you money with the added bonus of being able to travel without being plugged into a PC (at a cost of some computing power), so you can take it on vacation.The ability to be a travelling/standalone system is unique to Quest, so if that's important to you add another star to my review.If you're wanting to play primarily on PC and/or have wide glasses, subtract a star from my review.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2022
review_title: Bad if you have a large head or play connected to PC. Good otherwise. Great for vacation.

one_reviews_text: I wrote a previous review about my NC75 Pro Headphones- they are awesome.  Recently, my headphones stopped working as I was listening to them; I had only had them for less that six months. I couldn't figure out what happened. I read the instructions to see what it could be, but couldn't find anything. I contacted Srhythm on their website through email and explained the issue.  The company/Staff was great in helping and supporting the issue.  I was told that the problem could have been a defect in the headphones.  I was very pleased and satisfied with Stella's, and Eva's quick response back each time I emailed. All they wanted me to do was send them the order number, and a video of the problem. I did that.  The next email I received was letting me know that I was approved to receive another set of headphones with the attachments included.  Delivery was 5 -7 days- I received them in less time than that.  As I write this review, I have on my new headphones listening to my favorite music.  I recommend buying from Srhythm- they do respond back in a timely manner, and care about their customers.  They responded in a positive manner and resolved the issue.  I'm back to my routine of enjoying and using my NC75 Pro headphones. I am a happy camper.  Sincerely, Ursulla (very happy camper)

one_reviews_text: It's really a pretty cool experience. Even a lot of the free content through the TV app is cool.Like, you can experience cities from the vantage point of a drone flying over them. Or people paramotoring far from civilization.The games are also pretty immersive. I hadn't played games in quite a while, but I've been playing more on this because it's more engaging overall.The main benefit of the Quest though, is that it's really cheap compared to other VR headsets and has a larger library of games. The Varjo Aero might be better, but the basic headset costs $2K, and then you need additional hardware to make it work.The Meta Quest 2 gives you a pretty good experience for $300... Unless its IPD adjustments don't match the width of your eyes.  But for the most part that hasn't bothered anyone I know too much.Your eyes also seem to adapt some after you've used the headset regularly for a bit. I used to find it a little blurry in one eye but now it almost immediately seems clear when I put it on.

one_reviews_text: I have been having a ton of fun with this VR set but found myself frustrated when it suddenly wouldn’t charge after about a month of use. Talking to customer service and searching the internet I found out sometimes if you try to charge immediately after a long playing session, the internal battery will not hold a charge because it it overheated. The device never feels hot, so it isn’t possible to know whether or not your battery is overheated. Best tip I can give is always give your device at least 20 minutes to cool before plugging it in to charge. I know, that adds time and is annoying but it’s the only thing I’ve found that really works. This is a consistent problem from what I’ve been reading. I hope Meta/Oculus figures out how to prevent this in future models.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 13 April 2022

one_reviews_text: I got the Quest 2 and was exited to get started with it. Went through the setup and made a facebook account to do the setup. Was pretty annoyed that I needed a FB account to use my Quest but whatever. After I got done with the setup the Facebook account instantly got disabled. With that I cant use the Quest besides going into it and looking around. Screw Facebook. If youre going to force me to use it DONT LOCK ME OUT FOR USING IT!!! If you have a facebook account already and use it im sure youll be fine but if you dont have account be aware that you'll probably have the same issueEdit:So after going to support that didn't help at all cause it's a Facebook issue I just reset the thing and made a new account and no issues with that. And I gotta say not having to deal with wires sbd being able to play anywhere is very nice. I have a HTC vive with wireless but this is a way better wireless experience. It's just a shame the Facebook requirement really effected my initial opinion on it and makes gard to recommend to anyone who don't already use facebook. But ill give it 3 stars cause of the ease of use

one_reviews_text: While I do believe VR is the future in gaming I don’t think Occulus is it. Although  comparatively low priced it falls short for many reasons: It’s always blurry, creates eye strain , too heavy, uncomfortable head strap, too few games, doesn’t really facilitate glasses, randomly glitches etc etcIf not for the pandemic we would have seen Xbox & Nintendo VR by now and while PS VR is technically available getting one at a fair price is difficult at best. Consoles are bought for the games that are available for them and the Occulus library is too sparse.Clearly consumers want VR and will tolerate even crappy VR like Occulus while waiting for The Real Deal. However it will ultimately end up in the graveyard 🪦 for poor tech-as it should.

one_reviews_text: The quest 2 is awesome. It’s a computer! You can search the web in 3D, watch p***, play awesome games with a non toxic community. It has some absolutely amazing features….you can even connect your computer to it and work in 3D with your colleagues. I am hard to please and I was blown away. Even the lightsaber game will give you a fun workout.Buy one, you won’t be disappointed…unless you have a 2000$ computer and can run the big boy VRs.Just my 2 cents.I walked around my house at night with my headset on, dark as heck, and ate, took a poop, all while watching Netflix.

one_reviews_text: If you use the quest for exercise, expect it to be blurry 1/2 the time. I use the quest mostly to play beat saber and these problems are not solvable mostly due to triggering system problems when trying to work around blurry issues. Two major sources of blurriness: fogging and headset moving down on the face due to its weight and sweat making the silicone pad slippery.To reduce fogging, hang out in the same room with headset for 15 min but don’t do any exercise during that time. Your face and the headset need to be close to the same temp. This will reduce fogging but won’t eliminate it because exercise causes you body temp to rise.To keep the headset from blurring, you can try tightening the straps but, that will eventually trigger a system issue where the headset will temporarily go black and/or pause the game. Adjusting the headset while in game can trigger the same issue.Removing the headset and wiping away sweat can cause multiple problems such as fogging, loss of guardian, going blank or triggering of other system issues. If it works, it will quickly slip down again going blurry.I have tried the standard and elite strap. My next experiment is to try a counter balanced strap.Note: I have not mentioned the multiple system issues that combined with the blurry problem will eventually cause me to give up and let the quest collect dust.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2021
review_title: Plan to spend 1/2 of the time playing while blurry

one_reviews_text: My 15yr old son asked for this as his bday, at first I was hesitant that he wouldn't really play it since he loves his PS5, BUT THIS HAS GOT HIM OFF HIS BED AND OUT OF HIS ROOM! He uses it in the living room where there's more room, and he is active!! He's probably lost 10 pounds and this helps him exercise, he's NOT overweight or anything but he can be pretty lazy sometimes, and I love to watch him. Even tried it myself and it was pretty amazing!

one_reviews_text: I am not a big gamer, but I am truly enjoying the fitness app Supernatural.  It has got me moving (and liking it) for the first time in a long time.  The Oculus is amazing, and I'm sure I have only scratched the surface of all it can do.  I only took off a star because I have had to buy several accessories in order to use the headset comfortably while exercising.  I have purchased a headband, face masks, anti-fog spray and a fan attachment.  The fan attachment works great at keeps lenses clear.  Also, the subscription to Supernatural was an additional purchase.  I think it's worth it to make exercise fun. Overall, I really love the Oculus, but be prepared to spend extra $$ on apps and accessories.

one_reviews_text: First off, Amazon says I have to prove I didn't receive the $50 gift card - looks like I'm not the only one that didn't receive one. The quest is great when it works. I've had to factory reset once already to solve a black screen issue. I would put it on my head, adjust it at any time and it would go black and beep, need to shake my head around to get screen back or reboot. Frustrating when you're in the middle of a game! Also, it goes to sleep when watching a movie or guided meditation and it constantly wants me to setup the guardian area again. A factory reset helped the black screen issue for about a day. I'm RMAing this one because I don't think something should have to be reset within the first week of use and don't think I should have to prove to Amazon that I didn't receive the gift card when they can see others are having the same issue. Very frustrated with Amazon. I'll buy another one, but not from Amazon.

one_reviews_text: I bought this as a Christmas gift for my husband. He used it for boxing workouts. After a month or so, the Oculus got stuck in a boot loop and wouldn’t turn on … just kept trying to boot up without success. He went through Meta support. He was told to box up the device and mail it. He kept checking in, but weeks later the replacement hadn’t arrived. It finally did, rebranded as Meta Quest 2. It worked for a few days, then it got the black screen of death. Support has taken days to get back to him, then they finally replied and told him to do a factory reset. He’d tried that before he contacted them. So far, he probably has been without a working device longer than he’s had a working device. And he’s been extremely frustrated in his dealings with customer service. This whole experience has been unacceptable. It was a splurge gift that he should be able to enjoy. Instead, he’s spent a good portion of the warranty period without a working device.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 April 2022
review_title: Keeps breaking, dealing with Meta is a nightmare

one_reviews_text: You've bought this. You're excited by it. Can't wait to get into playing, and exploring. You've bought a bunch of accessories. Official accessories. But, then you use it.The biggest flaw in the engineering of this unit is, ventilation. There is no fix for it, via Oculus. There are a few third party companies that offer face plates that might help and 1...and I mean "1" small mountable fan unit that sucks hot air out to help with the lenses fogging up and you sweating like you're in a sauna.C'mon Oculus...which is now no more, or atleast absorbed by FB/Meta. You couldn't have constructed your own accessorie(s) to eliminate the issue??So, if you are considering it. Just know that you may get away with using it for an hour without starting to sweat. And, forget boxing or using the workout/fitness apps.All in all the experience, though dampened by the ventilation issue, is fun. The ability to not be tethered to a wire nor a lit of Oculus store apps, is my fav plus. Hook it up to your capable pc, and play other pc vr compatible games.

one_reviews_text: First: delivery to Russia took 3 weeks. Item arrived well packaged, customs taxes were around $15.The headset itself is a mixed bag.From one side, in *some* apps the immersion is amazing. But those apps and videos are extremely rare. You can only find really immersive videos in the Oculus TV app. They look like 8K 3D, and they are very impressive.There's a lot of 360 degree videos on Youtube, but Quest 2 can only play them in 4K. And in this resolution they look like if you run lowest quality 360p heavily compressed Youtube video on your 50" TV. I mean it's ugly.Those (seemingly) 8K 3D videos from Oculus TV mostly require to be downloaded before playback. And their resolution looks like 720p on 50" TV. Definitely not amazing in terms of resolution, but still very immersive. I can only wander how immersive will be 12K and 24K 3D videos in the distant future.The main problem is... I already watched most of these videos in a week. There's nothing left. All other videos even in Oculus TV are between bad and ugly in quality.On the "home screen" (or home ambience) everything looks like...well... if you had a myopia.The headset often "forgets" the safe play area, and shows positioning errors. A couple of days ago I had to reboot it twice to get rid of this error.All in all, it feels like both technology and content are still in the early development stage. Maybe in 5-10 years it will really become a mature product, but now it's more of a concept or demo.I didn't try Quest 2 linked to PC because I don't have a compatible PC.And the games... well, those I tried to play look like back to 90's. Visual quality is from bad to mediocre, gameplay is extremely simple and limited, but pricing is like AA titles on PC.Notice: I use Quest 2 as a standalone headset. This is my first VR headset, I have nothing to compare.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 January 2022
review_title: Good piece of tech still in the early development stage

one_reviews_text: Estamos MUY DESILUSIONADOS Y MOLESTOS CON LA COMPRA DEL OCULUS QUEST 2, la 1ra vez anularon la compra después de unos días, y decidimos hacer de nuevo la compra porque nuestro hijo de 11 años insistió. Realizamos la compra del producto y todo iba bien, incluso al hacer seguimiento DECÍA QUE LLEGABA  EL 29 DE SEPTIEMBRE. Ayer, mi hijo todo el día feliz esperando su Oculus, y creíamos que sólo se habían retrasado en repartir en Chile, pero en la noche nos llegó un correo diciendo que sería reembolsado el monto. Nosotros no queremos el reembolso, QUEREMOS EL PRODUCTO y sentimos que LE HAN FALLADO A NUESTRO HIJO Y LE HAN CAUSADO UNA ENORME PENA. Queremos una explicación al respecto, porque nunca habíamos tenido problemas con Amazon y esta vez el daño ha sido hacia nuestro niño.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 30 September 2021

one_reviews_text: This is a great product. Amazing capabilities. HOWEVER, it should come with a serious disclaimer regarding people who suffer with motion sickness. I tried. I really tried. Used motion sickness medicine, tried only sitting down while using it, chewed ginger candy, limited my time every use. After more than a week, I was getting sicker and sicker using it, Also felt very claustrophobic with the goggles on. Regretfully, I gave up and ended up returning the device. Found out that this is a problem for some people and I should have known. Oh well, it's still a great product if you can handle it... I can't do merry go rounds or coasters or cruises either.

Thankfully we just got it so it was an easy full replacement of the Oculus for a new one which was an easy and fast process.Other than that, time will tell but I think the more use, the more wear so I'd imagine more replacement parts but they are fun for what they are.

one_reviews_text: Ante todo quiero decir que es un producto excelente, no hay spoilers, realmente el análisis va a ser positivo.⭐️Puntos fuertes ⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Excelente diseño, desde la caja/empaque hasta el casco y los joysticks.Minimalista, pero elegante.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El hardware es muy bueno por el precio, XR2 de Snapdragon, 6 GB de ram (es mucho!), pantalla 4k, sonido envolvente, y sobre todo: standalone! Es decir, están pensadas para jugar de forma autónoma, sin necesidad de cables porque tienen su propia batería!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Los juegos son muy divertidos, he probado el Beat Saber (el juego TOP del que todos hablan) y es fabuloso, pero también testeé el super hot, y es increíblemente inmersivo, muy pero muy divertido!⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️Los controles con precisos, perfectos casi, el reconocimiento de movimiento es milimétrico, y todo responde de maravilla.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El sistema Guardián es impresionante, puedes delimitar tu área de juego, incluso puedes "escanear" tu sofá para jugar cómodamente en él.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️El sonido es muy bueno, realmente suena bien, me gustaría probarlo con audífonos.⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️La batería dura lo suficiente, se echa en falta carga rápida (sobre todo porque utiliza conector usb-c).⭐️⭐️⭐️⭐️La pantalla es muy buena, incluso funciona a 120hz!💥Puntos no tan fuertes💥Las correas no son muy cómodas, toma su tiempo ajustarlas. Es casi una compra obligada una correa de mayor calidad.El punto justo de visión es variable dependiendo de cada persona, pero su ajuste es bastante complicado, toma su tiempo y varios intentos.Se echa en falta una funda de serie para protegerlos (no les puede dar la luz del sol, o se quema la pantalla, atención con este detalle!).Los controles deberían tener una referencia física de R y L (derecha e izquierda) es fácil confundirlos.Deberían incluir algunos juegos precargados, o bien algunos juegos de regalo al comprar el equipo, para poder utilizarlo y testearlo a full, antes de pasar por caja.⚠️Exige utilizar una cuenta de Facebook, la privacidad se ve completamente comprometida, además, si la cuenta es dada de baja por la empresa, se pierden todas las compras y dólares invertidos en la misma, mucho cuidado con eso! ⚠️----------------------------------------------------------------------Conclusión.Es un producto superior, a un precio muy bajo en relación a lo que ofrece.Indispensable para todo gamer, es mucho más divertido que las consolas de sobremesa, y el efecto WOW es totalmente real, es otro mundo, y la experiencia es alucinante.Le pongo un 9, es un producto casi perfecto.Súper recomendado!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 February 2022

one_reviews_text: Even with new batteries, both controllers will short out. Guardian will show error as if it's not detected when not moving from the area. Controllers will glitch in game play as in they won't detect movement at certain times. If I take out the new battery for the right one and put it back in, it works fine for only about 10 minutes then says check battery & disconnects again. Charge on headset lasts about 30 minutes if that. Noticed when first purchased battery lasted on headset for 45 to 50 minutes. Manufacturer makes it difficult to request warranty help.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 May 2022

one_reviews_text: if youre wondering...yes its worth it and u should get one. mostly use it for exercise. beat saber and the boxing and workout apps are worth it. i got the 128G i think and its more than enough room for all my apps. no need to get the higher capacity. welcome to VR my friends
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 March 2022

one_reviews_text: Excellent VR, I have tried most of the VR's in the market and I can say the Oculus Quest 2 is the very best out there. Excellent immersion, a very complete and robust marketplace. Being Android can't go wrong. It's excellent for gaming the VR quality games, it's quite good for reading, great for watching videos. Comfortable navigating with the super responsive controllers and quite easy to type on the virtual keyword.The headset is quite comfortable and adjustable to your eyesight. If you wear glasses it has an additional extension you can put but I felt it was putting too much stress on my glasses and they might break so I don't wear them with the Oculus. But unless you have considerable sight loss you probably won't need to wear them with the Oculus.*Downsides:* as good as it is the technology of VR is still extremely limited and it's pretty much just watching a big screen around you like if you were in a planetarium. You will not feel the level of realism or immersion of Cyberpunk genre Science Fiction. We are decades or maybe even a century away from that.The headset is comfortable but if you wear it for over an hour it starts getting very uncomfortable and some people might get headaches.It's still mostly a gimmick to have fun. For work, meetings, or "adult" practical use is mostly useless.Some people will have issue that you are forced to use your Facebook account.Different profiles / accounts is kind of tedious. It's probably best for single person use.If you are in stationary mode it's good for watching videos or reading. But to fully experience it or game with it you need lots of space, 6.5 sqft so be conscious of that before buying.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2021
review_title: Excellent VR, probably best on the market

one_reviews_text: After using this for a month, I think you're fine with getting the base model. one_reviews_text: This virtual reality headset makes me feel like I am living in the future. I don't hate the console style monetization as that encourages development of new games, despite the high price tag. At least for now there is no subscription service and that will suffice for now. Besides there are many great free games as well, such as Echo VR and Pavlov Shack Beta.The stock headset comes with an ok strap and lackluster battery life both of which can be remedied with more money for an improved strap, some of which come with batteries.Virtual Reality sickness is very real and you will most likely experience it in your first couple games where your body movement does not line up with your character movement, such as in Echo VR. This problem doesn't exist in Beat Saber or Super Hot and you can exclusively play stationary games if you so choose.Overall, the Oculus (Meta) Quest 2 brings virtual reality to the masses with a plethora of super cool features, hand tracking and passthrough are both pretty good. However, the relatively low price point gives it some drawbacks that are acceptable at this stage of the game.

review_title: Honest - I dont get why - right now why i needed this

one_reviews_text: Okay so if you encounter this review you may be surprised why I have not blindly given this product a solid 5 stars.First things first, the pros. It is an overall good and functional HMD. Unlike the compeition, it supports both standalone software for those that do not have a VR ready gaming PC. PCVR connectivity is pretty much plug and play if you do decide to go through that style of gameplay. It also has a wireless option if your home network can support it.Another thing is that setup is extremely easy. Inside out tracking is pretty decent and does not require basestations or lighthouses for tracking unlike the competition. The resolution is higher in comparison to the previous iterations of Oculus HMDs. This HMD is a good entry level VR headset.Now for the cons. Off the bat, the stock strap is not really good. I can see children and adults with below average head sizes being fine with the headstrap but, for an average or larger adult head size, you won't be able to play for more than 30 minutes without the headset putting strain towards your cheekbones. Other cases have reported irritation to the ears. The only solution to this would be to invest in their "elite strap" which in my opinion, should have been the stock strap. To be honest, a 3rd party halo strap would be a better investment than their OEM elite strap.Now for the facial interface. It is sandpaper to the face. If you ordered this HMD prior to having an included silicone cover, expect to get face marks and rashes. Although the new silicone cover has prevented further problems, it is still not comfortable as the cushioning is still too firm on the interface itself. Expect to spend more for a 3rd party facial interface.Now for gameplay and experience. Remember how earlier I mentioned the increased resolution from previous Oculus models, it does not matter now. If you are someone who is planning to solely use this HMD for PCVR/SteamVR, you're gonna have a hard time wondering how this is an upgrade from other HMDs on the market. The amount of compression and artifacts I have noticed playing is just beyond acceptable. I do not understand why Facebook (or Meta whatever) decided to solely use USB C to encode both audio and video through the headset. They could've at least made use of adding a display port (or even an HDMI port for all I care). The increase in resolution is useless at this point. Even if you change and max out settings through their desktop app, debug tool and 3rd party Oculus tray tool, those same artifacts and compression in image quality is noticable. The HTC Vive has a better PCVR experience than this considering that it is older. I can understand that the main purpose of this headset was to be a consumer friendly standalone headset but for those of us that bought this thinking it would be a step up for PCVR gameplay, I am sorry to say this but we were scammed. I am hoping that the developers do realize that is a problem and consider investing a good portion of their time finding a credible solution. If you think about it, the hardware power is there with the Quest 2, but the software implementation and execution is extremely buggy.Finally defects. Unfortunately, when my Quest 2 arrived, it came with a defective right touch controller. The issue was that the thumb capacitor was not sensing thumb movement. This is gamebreaking if you play games with hand gestures. Moreover, my unit came with dead pixels when bringing up passthrough mode. Although not game breaking, it was still annoying. After looking through some online forums, these seemed to be consistent problems with other people. Luckily Amazon offered to exchange my unit for a completely brand new one free of charge.Overall it is a functional HMD and a steal for the price but it still has a long way to becoming the greatest HMD on the market. More importantly, PCVR experience. I would advise the developers to look further to improving PCVR as a significant amount of people bought this for that sole purpose. With rumours of a Valve Index 2 in the works with supposed standalone support included, Oculus needs to find a way to keep up.Update: I just received replacement Amazon sent me to replace my defective unit turns out to be much worse. There is rattling components inside and I was advised by support to replace it again due to risk of short circuiting! I am actually worried that something might blow up while I am playing. I have downgraded my rating from 2 stars to 1. If the 3rd replacement is still defective, I am refunding ASAP. I don't know if it is just me but the quality control has been poor so far.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 31 December 2021
review_title: Its Functional but needs more changes to keep up, especially with PCVR. Quality Control sucks too!

one_reviews_text: Go to oculus webiste and go to support, make sure to open a chat window, dont call them or do an email, because quite frankly, you're as impatient as me. The chat window option is hard to find for support but if the gods bless you then you will stumble upon its beauty. Right off the bat (being impatient) open the ticket with what you want done, unlinking. The way I finally got support to do it for me was not making it an option, I made it clear I was not requesting to unlink, I NEEDED to unlink, it was a NEED. Not a request. You paid 299 for this bad boi and you deserve some authoritay. I also made it clear that oculus was my issue (bamboozled them) saying I wanted to unlink my oculus from my facebook, not vice versa, and not is that it was possible. That it was happening. When they ask the reason, say "I unfortunately cannot disclose that information." You are welcome :)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2022
review_title: How to unlink your fb account (may take multiple attempts)

one_reviews_text: So idk. So Ive owned the samsung Odyssey plus going on 3 years and i wanted better tracking.The goodThe oculus quest has better graphics when using the usb link cableIt is wireless and works using wifi but the quality goes up and down based on the wifi connectionTracking of the controllers is a lot betterThe link cable is thin and light compared to the OdysseyThe badNarrow field of view compared to the OdysseyFace hugger, narrow face opening compared to the OdysseyNarrow field of viewWeirdly positioned focal point its at the bottom of the lenses so the headset sits more on top of your head as to straps to your faceThis focal point is very small and if the headset moves you loose focus or if you look away from centerThe IPD adjustment doesnt go wide enoughThe controllers are small, too smallBottom lineBetter technology worse ergonomicsOdyssey on top in the pic

one_reviews_text: Great product. Used it for almost 3 weeks. $299 is not much expensive compared with a full set of Index VR($999). Of course, to play games on desktop, index can bring much better experience to players. However, comes to flexibility, Quest 2 is the best for now. No base station is required, just set up the guardian and play at anytime, anyplace. There are many games on oculus store, but they are not very attracted to me. I mostly used it to play desktop games as a replacement of index, my experience is great. Can go wired (oculus link, charging while playing) and fully wireless (air link).Overall, if you are that person like me, want to try VR but don’t want to invest much on it, Quest 2 could be the best option. I don’t like the Facebook company but I appreciate the Quest 2 develop team. They keep adding new features in each experimental update.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 21 December 2021

one_reviews_text: It’s super fun and the graphics are amazing :)! I was afraid it would be too heavy but it’s very light. It’s comfortable to wear, but I would recommend a $30 elite strap because the white fabric strap gets very dirty and you can’t clean it nicely. An elite strap it also very helpful for active games. The battery time for the console isn’t very good, but there are cons to something as light and power consuming as this. Some elite straps have battery packs, but it’s probably not good for you to be in vr over 2 hours anyway and it might be uncomfortably heavy. The experience of vr is a MUST HAVE, and for 300 bucks and 128gb it’s a STEAL! If you plan to play games like beatsaber, definitely get controller protectors. I am impressed with their durability (I have SMASHED them super hard against each other and my walls) and they haven’t cracked yet but i’m going to quick buy some covers now to be safe. Over all, pretty much all cons are expected results of the pros, and I would recommend!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 May 2022
review_title: Very fun with a few expected cons, still a MUST HAVE EXPERIENCE!!!

one_reviews_text: The image quality is good.  The controls are comfortable.  If you're looking for mobile VR, this will probably work, so long as you don't require a large library of games, because this device has only a handful of decent titles, and the rest of its library is of extremely low quality.Battery life is abysmal. We explored the world through the Wander app. We had so much fun watching each other, and got some great laughs. Beware if you add the roller coaster. I can’t believe how real it feels. I had horrible motion sickness after that one though. I seriously couldn’t believe that I felt like I was going down the tracks of a coaster while standing in the living room.The only downside for me is that most of the games that he wants cost around $25 or more.It does come with free games, but he gets tired of them pretty quickly.So parents heads up about the games. one_reviews_text: I would give this Headset a 5 star but there are some pros and cons.Pros:1. Very user friendly, it gives an option to skip tutorials for more experienced users2. Inexpensive compared to other headsets especially standalone with no wires3. The built in speakers are amazing!4. The controllers are very durable, I’ve hit my walls on accident multiple times really hard, and they still work fine5. Very customizableCons:1. Even with the glasses spacer it is not very friendly for glasses users2. Lenses fog up INSANELY quick3. Built in battery life only lasts about 2-4 hours4. The stock headset straps are really uncomfortable after long use and the headset doesn’t really sit securely5. This has only happened a couple times to me, but it is a serious problem. When playing, the headset loses tracking of the controllers for a couple seconds, then they work just fine. I don’t know if this is from smacking them up against a wall or the sensors problemBesides all of the cons, this headset is DEFINITELY worth it. I got addicted instantly and it’s a great way to work out and play games at the same time. It is a PERFECT gift for anyone. I recommend buying a couple additional things like the elite strap and a charging dock, other than that, this thing is amazing! 10/10 would buy another.

one_reviews_text: We love it so much that we got 2 more so we can have friends over and he/she can use the third one. It was not hard to follow the onscreen instruction to get it set up, but it was a bit confusing at first when trying to pair with your phone. You definitely need facebook for now to be able to sign in and use it.The games are fun, we play a lot of mutiplayer games, and for those who suffers motion sickness like I do (I have ringing ears and vertigo, get yourself a fan blowing at yourself plus take some of those verb liquid for motion sickness that you can rub behind your ears), they will help or get games that have teleport feature.The headset is bad, consider getting a more comfortable headshet or it will feel very front heavy. The bettery life for the head unit is about 2hrs. while the batteries can last over a month of here and there using it.One thing though, if you PLAN to share the quest 2 with another person, the 128g will be divided by 2 users (meaning, each user will have 64g of space for games and such), and if you have three people sharing one, it will devide the space for 3 users... so you have limited space. That said, if you plan to share it with 3 users and creating 3 acounts on one quest 2, you can set primary and share that to the other two users within the headset, and if that's the case, get the 256g one for 3 users sharing would be my suggestion.

one_reviews_text: The Quest 2 is the way to go VR. Wireless is really awesome. I already had the wired version which I thought was terrific, but wireless is much better. The thing I like best is that it contains a web browser. I can watch Netflix, log onto my Facebook account, virtually anything I can do with my laptop, I can do with Quest 2. It also is backward compatible with my old VR set, which allows me to use all of the Apps I bought for it. I just turn on my laptop and link my Quest 2 to the laptop using the app that comes with Q 2. Couldn't be happier.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 January 2022

one_reviews_text: First Time With VR Easy To Setup for direct use, But Facebook Instantly Banned My Account When I made It, and due to it being the weekend I had to wait till Monday (I think I set it up on Friday evening), it works well but I was pretty upset that it took so long to get it ready for PC use. I wish the battery would stay alive while using it in my PC, perhaps I need a more powerful USB power port as the wall outlet works fine with perpetual use (though I can't tolerate it after like 2 hours). It's cheap, works and it's not a bad first experience. If you don't mind facebook as a company I guess you won't mind this one.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 December 2021
review_title: First Time With VR Easy To Setup, But Facebook Instantly Banned My Account When I made It.

one_reviews_text: This is amazing! My boyfriend absolutely loved is as a Christmas gift. Because the quest 2 is a mix of a console itself and a VR headset you can hook up to your computer, there are pros for buying games either through the oculus store or through steam. I suggest getting simple party games through oculus (ie job simulator) and buying games that can be modded on steam (ie boneworks).However, while there are some games that don’t require any distance moment (such as walking/running) a lot do and they’re very disorienting if you get motion sick. A pretty good indicator of whether or not you’ll be sick when playing on the quest 2 is if you get dizzy watching videos that are POV/spin frequently (ie the movie Mad Max)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 January 2022
review_title: Perfect gift if you don’t get motion sick

one_reviews_text: This is a great entry level VR headset for kids and adults.  Like others have said the only downside is that you need a Meta (Facebook) account.  If you are tech savvy you can create a simple gmail and Meta account that does not get flagged. (Very easy if you are worried about privacy).  Told they will be removing this requirement in the future.  Provides hours of fun.  Highly recommend getting the Link cable so you can connect to pc and play other games.  May actually buy another just so we can play against each other as a family or when the kids have friends over.  Definitely recommend as you will not be disappointed for the price.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 December 2021
review_title: Great entry level VR for both kids and adults

one_reviews_text: I don’t typically get motion sickness, but boy oh boy, Oculus has made me queasy a bunch of times. So do it in short time frames consistently.Also if you have glasses, it’s a bit tricky, even with the headset accommodation. I thought I’d exercise some but my glasses just fog up and the fit is odd.So I’ve enjoy the 360 videos (relaxing) on YouTube and I loved the rollercoaster (until I got motion sick).It will take some getting use to. But I love it even with the quirks.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 27 January 2022

one_reviews_text: No issues aside from trying to cast it so I can watch my husband play and vice versa but that's an occulus issue not amazon. It does make me motion sick and my husband as well and he normally doesn't have that issue any other time. Take some dramamine and it helps some. The games are super short and expensive but again that is an oculus thing not Amazon.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 18 November 2021

one_reviews_text: I had been waiting for a headset that balanced mobility and affordability before I jumped into the VR world, and this is it!! Having the whole system in the headset is a big game changer, and the battery life is long enough to get some good plays in (and short enough to remind me to take a break!). I thought the memory would be an issue, but 128 is plenty for the current VR game landscape. Overall super satisfied and would totally recommend!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 December 2021

one_reviews_text: -Much heavier than the oculus rift. You'll be feeling it on your face the entire time.-No earphones; another step down.-Extremely fragile components-Cheap plasticy feel. Seems like they cut corners in production.-Setup is a nightmare. When trying to pair it to your phone, as required, be wary of it bricking your device like it did mine. One factory reset and half a dozen attempts later, it finally connected for updates.-Charger cable is the shortest I haver ever seen-No visual indication on the plugs or ports what is right side up; bend an internal pin and you're paying for repairs or buying a new one.-Glasses spacer leaves about an inch extra where you nose should be, if you're secretly a bird then its just perfect for fitting your beak-Controllers are weirdly shaped. They don't feel natural in your hand at all.+ It powers on quickly+ The visual quality is a step up from the rift.+ The airlink allows you to connect to your pc without any additioonal cable, albeit with high requirements from both system performance and net speed.+ The calibration of Guardian was quick and painless compared to the rift, with obvious improvements in functionality. You're given the option to physically map the floor location,  and 'spray' on the boundary lines from a distance.I would suggest looking into other options in addition to the quest 2, then choose what features and drawbacks you can live with.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 28 March 2022

one_reviews_text: Once you figure things out (or, as I did, let my kids figure it out, then show me) the Oculus is a blast.  It is one step closer to the Oasis (from the book Ready Player One) (don't bother with the sequel book, it stunk).  The unit controls and hand controls are simple to use, and the pre-loaded games are enough to get going right out of the box.  Need a separate device if you want to cast to a tv, but they are inexpensive.  As a surprise gift to the family at Christmas, it was a big hit.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 March 2022

one_reviews_text: Yeah, its freedom unlike never before, but theres only like 20 games, if you want more games, real games. You have to do a bunch of extras to attempt to get more games hooking it up to a pc buying extras to maybe get more games, then you dont have that freedom anymore. Not enough game demos. The movement is idiotic especially in resident evil 4. The list goes on the prices for games are way to high. The free games suck. Is it worth the money, no. Watching movies or browsing the internet is just a big screen far to close to the eyes. Nothing about this product is magical. Am i writting this review to be helpful, kind of, but no. Im here to complain. Why would a couple of billionaires care if the product sucks. They get money no matter what because people pay for it to suck, then tell people its so good.

one_reviews_text: This is the perfect headset for anyone looking to get into virtual reality. It only takes 10-15 minutes to set up, and is very easy to use. It's wireless, and you don't need anything else to get playing, just the headset. Within 10 minutes I was fully set up and playing a climbing game. If you have a VR-Ready PC then you have the option to use a feature called Airlink where you can play PC-Exclusive games on your Quest 2 wirelessly. I definitely recommend buying this headset, especially at the amazing price of $299.Some games I recommend: Eleven Table Tennis, The Climb 2, Superhot VR, Beat Saber, Gorn, Rec Room, VR Chat, Pavlov Shack, and Boneworks (PC-Exclusive)

one_reviews_text: I don't use this headset a whole lot, but it's still pretty cool. There just isn't a lot of content yet, and the content that is there costs money, so I mainly use it to watch anime and talk on VRChat, which is free. For what it's worth, the graphics are really good. I remember playing a VR game with a headset back in the 90s at a carnival or something, and this blows those old graphics out of the water. Tech really has come a long, long way. Now the question becomes: Is VR going to be a passing fad, or will lots of people start using it in their daily lives? As of now, I use it maybe once or twice a week, and I can't say I'd ever use it more than that. Then again, though, that's what I said about Facebook back in the day, and look where we are now.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 February 2022
review_title: Not a ton of content yet, but it's pretty cool.

If you buy another game through another vendor, please note that this device is NOT going to make things easy for you. Nothing has been streamlined at all.In theory, the Quest 2 makes perfect sense.
