one_reviews_text: State of the art item that seems so much more advanced than the original oculus rift. No wires, sensors to set up, nothing. Just turn on and play. because the headset itself is the console. The spacer for eyeglasses is what sold me, but if you have a large glasses, maybe try buying prescription lenses (yes, that's a thing!) for about $30. You can insert the lenses and play without your glasses! Hoping more games come out soon. Especially social interactive ones where friends can play with you on their phones.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 December 2021
review_title: i've been waiting for this all year

one_reviews_text: I first got into VR several years ago with the original Vive, which I paid $600 for. And at the time that was a good price. But what many of us in VR agreed on is that while the tech is great, we need more people using it. We need more gamers and developers in the VR space, and $600 on top of a gaming PC, with a wire leading to the tower and laser devices to screw to your walls, it was never going to happen.The Quest has solved all of this. At a price point of $300 for the newest quest, you absolutely cannot match this value with any other VR hardware. On top of that, you don't need a gaming PC at all; this system is ready to boot and play for any adult or child right out of the box. This is absolutely revolutionary. And since we have the privilege of buying in 2021/22 instead of a few years ago, you're paying $300 (or less on sale) for a headset that is more capable in every way than the Vive I paid $600 for a few years ago. Compared to the Vive it is lighter, cooler, more comfy, has more naturally ergonomic controllers, and here's the big one: higher pixel density and virtually no screen door effect.You are stealing this device from facebook for $300.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 December 2021

one_reviews_text: On the better side is the improved optics.  On the worse side is the head straps. THAT SUCKS and makes we want to drop this to 2 stars, but that seemed unfair.

one_reviews_text: To put it simply, this headset is great if you want to play supported apps on the device itself. Anything outside of that is luck of the draw. I primarily bought this to pair up with my pc as affordable as it is in comparison to other VR products. My computer is up to spec for VR and I have a USB C cable that transfers 2.5 GB/s. It won't work as they say it will. I have heard through the internet that others have had similar issues as me. Airlink worked for the first day I had it but no longer works either. Tried ensuring my pc and software were as up to date as possible, reinstalling drivers, different cords, reinstalling drivers from device manager, disabling discrete graphics, etc etc. Trust me as a programmer/IT guy I tried a good 8 hours of various troubleshooting but it will not work. Avoid this product if you are buying to use with a PC. Your mileage may vary but I was only able to connect and use it once through airlink and only once at that. Also last I checked their support page is broken so good luck getting into support. Extremely disappointed on the false advertising of how simple and easy it is to use with PC. I'll choose differently next time.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 January 2022
review_title: Good luck if you want to use this with your PC

one_reviews_text: The tech is very good. As many have said head strap changes , battery add ons may enhance your experience. Biggest cons: don’t expect to put this on the market and expect kids to not ask for this, especially if they see it in another household. That is what happened to us.  The lack of timers/ parental controls on like on every other major platform is a major problem. It’s coding a lot of fights to turn it off, and my kids have manage to download inappropriate content despite trying to watch while it is casting on the TV ( the tv doesn’t show someone’s peripheral view and everything they are clicking on)

one_reviews_text: Intellivision turned me off gaming in the 80’s until the Oculus Quest 2.  All my friends had Atari with a joy stick and red button.  My dad thought I needed to be unique and play with a keypad and circular disk.  6814 pass.  6815 punt.  DAMN IT!  You know how many second down punts I’ve had in my gaming career?!?!  And 6913 drop the ball.  WTH?!  When is that a play you call?!?!Just got an Occulus Quest 2.  This thing is awesome!  Highly recommend it.  WAY better than the Intellivision of 1982.

review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 17 January 2022

one_reviews_text: This headset is terrific. I need to wear glasses most of the time, but this headset works fine without them. The resolution is great for the most part, thought text is a little hard to read if it's further than around 60 centimeters away, and the controllers feel great. I have 3 gripes, however. Firstly, the FOV is quite bad and I often get annoyed by how little I can see with my peripheral vision.On top of this, the headstrap hard to adjust and feels like it might fall off my head at any moment, and moving my head at any significant speed bumps it around and I have to readjust it (on a side note, I would recommend using the top strap to hold it on your head. Don't keep the headset pulled onto your face with the side straps. Those are to stop it moving around).And Finally, there is a lot of light that gets let in at the bottom of the headset and is quite distracting.In conclusion, the software and hardware of the headset itself is almost perfect, but the things surrounding that are less-than-stellar. I'd certainly recommend this headset though, as it is very cheap for what it is and only requires a single cable to connect it to your PC if you want to use Link. On a sidenote of using Link, don't use the cables on your case. Use the ones on your MOBO. This stopped my link from constantly crashing and reconnecting.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 10 December 2021

one_reviews_text: You should, you must experience the VR !!!And Oculus Quest is the cheapest way, i think... Its own games are great, but you can also buy the same games from Steam Store and download into the console. Yes it like a console, and another great thing is, it is standalone, you don't need any cables or something else.When you want to connect to PC, you can establish a connection with Airlink. It's also wireless!! But the disadvantage is Airlink drains the battery very well, like drinking it :)I've tried the Euro Truck Sim with a beta VR uptade and I'm shocked... Because when you watch the VR videos on YouTube or similar platforms, you couldn't see the true VR vision, because the monitors draws only 2D views, but in the VR set, there is a 3D modelled view, and it feels also very real.When i played ETS, i feel like i'm in the truck cabin, and i tried to touch the steering wheel :)I recommend every player, it's a great product.

Prototypes at science centers to the Nintendo virtual boy to cell phone kits to the Oculus rift developer and consumer models. All have been enjoyable, but the virtual boy and cell phone models were too basic, and the prototypes and rift being tethered limited the immersion. Right now it's the best option available for great vr experience. Highly recommend.

one_reviews_text: What an absolute POS. I solely bought this because I was so thrilled to play resident evil 4. It played it amazing for the first week I had it. Let it sit for about 2 months or so as I had to move and had other things such as work to take care of. Now turning it back on it’s plagued by updates that won’t finish and games that won’t update either. I’ve hard reset it everything you can imagine and it’s still a brick…. Also no way to clear app cache, meaning any game application that you have that it decides it can’t open or play anymore has to be re downloaded and good luck with that. It’s a shame. You’d think a tech giant this big would know better? I guess the moral of my experience is it’s great in the beginning but don’t ever let it sit or it will brick itself with mountains of unnecessary updates that the system can’t recover from.

one_reviews_text: It is actually insane how amazing and futuristic this device is. The surround sound is great, the movements are flawless, the battery lasts long enough. It did make me motion sick (I lived on a boat for 3 months without getting seasick but this got me), I followed a tip and played in smaller increments until I got used to it. Now it doesnt make me sick at all. The headset could be more comfortable but it is not uncomfortable. The lenses get sweat on them because the mask is "hot." You dont really feel like its hot but at some point you will notice you are sweating. A good workout but it does make the lenses need to be wiped every so often.Still, five stars. This device could have many more issues and it would still not lose a star. It is so insane for its price, and just as a device in general, it should get 15 stars.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 25 April 2022
review_title: This is insane. You would not believe how real it seems. The motion sickness goes away quick.

one_reviews_text: I bought these for my kids but I am enjoying it as well. The visual/picture quality is stunning and really gives a reality feel to the experience. Being able to virtually experience different parts of the world I can't get enough of! Highly recommend this for kids and adults. Although I imagine for a child younger than 8 it would be too heavy and too large for fitting. I have to keep adjusting the strap for my 8 year old but it does fit his head.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 5 January 2022

one_reviews_text: I have found navigating through the system is somewhat difficult.  My biggest problem I have with the Oculus is the quality of the visual.  I find it blurry no matter how I adjust the unit.  The battery does not last long.  I played for about 45 minutes yesterday and the battery was down to about 50%.  I was also starting to get a headache from the blurriness.  I think this would be 5 stars if the videos were crystal clear.  I think I will be returning it.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 December 2021

one_reviews_text: I recommend this to any person that is interested in using VR, everything is right there for you!! You dont have to use anything else to download content and 128GB lets me play more than 6 games so far. I’m in love with it and my family had so much fun with it, you definitely get your money’s worth. But the only thing that gave me trouble is chrome casting it on roku, that was tough and I had to order a google chrome caster so hopefully that will work, will try to update y’all about it. And You’ll need to be in a well lit space to play, you can’t play in the dark or a really dimmed area. But day 2 of having it and everything is good, it also came fast with same day delivery didn’t recall the order nor cancellation. It’s perfect. 5 stars, hopefully this review help you guys out for Christmas!! Happy holidays
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 December 2021

one_reviews_text: DO NOT BUY.Great fun at first, but Facebook banned my account without explanation or no means of recourse. This is becoming more common and can happen to anyone! All the games (that aren't cheap) are now worthless and my Occulus is essentially a brick. HUGE waste of money!*EDIT*After contacting Occulus directly (and over social media) they were able to re-instate my Facebook account. Still it was a very long and frustrating experience
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 January 2022
review_title: DO NOT BUY! Find an alternative VR headset!

one_reviews_text: Difference between this one and it’s predecessor is quite unbelievable. I was able to put the headset on draw perimeter I would not walk out of.  kept it five minutes and returned it because it was so real it freaked the crap out of me
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 May 2022
review_title: So real I returned it, because it freaked the crap out of me

one_reviews_text: The quest 2 is by far better than my rift s. Every time I use my headset, I forget there is no cable so it is odd to me but freeing. The responsiveness is amazing and the feel of every thing is great. It fits my eyes just fine, but I won't guarantee that it will fit everyone's eye size. Double check the space in between your eyes are supported by the quest before buying it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 October 2021

one_reviews_text: You should buy the oculus quest 2 if you want:-Terrible facebook integration-Bad hardware-Buggy and barely working software-The worst customer support you have ever seen, they actually don't care at all about you-Bugs and glitches with the software that have been discovered well over a year ago still not being fixed and with no signs of being fixed-Cool experimental features with the only caveat being that they barely ever workIf you are looking to get into VR, do not buy this headset. It will only disappoint you.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 14 April 2022
review_title: The Worst VR Set on the Market

one_reviews_text: I play in VR literally every day, and honestly, the only problem I have with this particular headset, is it's inability to track in the dark, (without some sort of assistance)It's so annoying, because I really love playing horror games, and games like phasmophobia in the dark,to get more immersed in the game, and while it does try really hard to track you, and surroundings in the dark, don't expect it to hold up for very long, besides this issue, this is actually a decent VR headset.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 April 2022
review_title: It's a VR Headset, not bad, but not great either.

one_reviews_text: Pro: The Headset is fantastic and work perfectly. Battery lasts for about 2 hours on a full charge which is more then enough. Love works well on PC with a Link Cable (Even with 3rd party cable). Airlink works somewhat ok, however it is still in beta.Cons: Why does Meta require that I use Facebook to use the headset that I paid for? It is ridiculous that I don't get the option to turn off social settings. I have an Oculus Account, but Meta forces you to merge it to a Facebook account. I would have given this a 5 out of 5, but Facebook can't resist on getting access to personal data. If Facebook got rid of that requirement, this would be the best headset to buy on the market.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 January 2022

one_reviews_text: This is so much better than PS VR in terms of setup, connection and visual quality. The freedom of movement without any wires and tracking is amazing.AirLink works great, no complaints from me.Battery lifetime is acceptable, but it can discharge pretty quickly just lying there.The ability to view the actual space around you with external cameras is a lifesaver.The stock head strap is abysmal, the headset is practically constantly weighing down on your face, and you need to adjust it every couple of minutes.It's nearly impossible to wear it with glasses, the frame is just not big enough.It has some issues correctly identifying floor level in seated position. And if there is no setting for this in the game, you will view the world as a leprechaun.I don't like the required integration with Facebook, but it is what it is.All in all I'm very happy with the purchase, the device is marvelous for it's price. I like the PC VR games, I like the standalone capabilities and what I can do with it. I just need to get a new head strap.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 11 March 2022

one_reviews_text: I've played VR before, but it's always been done with the whole set-up: gaming computer, room sensors, etc. I was nervous about the idea of a standalone system, but the Oculus Quest 2 did not disappoint. I love not being tethered to a cord. The battery doesn't last longer than a couple of hours, but I never play too long at a time anyway so it's not a problem. It provides a very immersive experience and I love it!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 22 March 2022

one_reviews_text: For an item that costs $300, I expected more than this. Me and my children played on the oculus for about 5 hours when it needed to be recharged. After charging, it would not detect the left controller. Kept saying that the battery was low, even after replacing the battery. Yes, I was using alkaline AA 1.5v. I tried unpairing and repairing...tried it after keeping the batteries out for 5 minutes. Tried factory resetting the headset. Nothing works. I can only surmise that the controller is faulty. After some searching on the web, I find out that this is a very common issue.Then, when I go to report a problem...."Oh, we'll get back to you in 1 or 2 days." No number. No live chat. Just support tickets. Horrible customer service. I would skip shelling out the money for this system until they get this fixed. It's completely ridiculous.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 March 2022
review_title: Only worked for a few hours

one_reviews_text: We love it. The graphics are amazing and the games we've checked out are such high quality. The whole family can find something they like. Even the menu screen is super impressive. Don't buy games to use with vr ( many of those require special vr such as ps4) but... you can buy & download the games directly on the occulus to play so get get larger capacity one!  Also, you can play with friends from their own house!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 March 2022

one_reviews_text: I bought this for my 13 year old. I hoped that it would add a fun element to our homeschool PE routine. It definitly shakes things up. I love it almost as much as he does. If are going to engage in any hard play, do yourself a favor and buy one of the cloth covers for the silicone lined face mask. It prevents moisture build up while you play. Awesome VR experience!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 8 January 2022
review_title: This virtual reality machine is a whole lot of fun!

one_reviews_text: This is the first vr headset we've ever used and it is awesome. It works great as a stand alone and connected to gaming pc via oculus connect or app. We did purchase the more comfortable head strap and it was worth it. Would suggest using in 15min increments at first to get used to it. The guardian "app" works great and keeps you safe in play area. Would highly suggest getting this vr headset, it has something for everyone's enjoyment.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 January 2022

one_reviews_text: So works great or worked great. had it for like 2 months and was fantastic till the left controller stopped pairing. Did all the troubleshooting. No physical damage to the unit. Just defective. Ater 4 straight hours of a massive amount of back and forth between amazon and occulus support , Amazon said they were willing to replace the unit but I have to ship it to them from SA out of my own pocket. Simply wanted a replacement controller that wouldnt cost me a arm and a leg. Support was terrible. Kept passing me from person to person. Kept having to repeat everything. Why am I paying out of pocket for defective under warranty products? NOT IMPRESSED AT ALL!

Visually this look really good. Controls work well as far as I can tell. I don't usually play for longer than about 45 minutes, but it makes me sweat really hard. Love, love, love this system. You need a Facebook account, but most people already have one. Buy it!

one_reviews_text: This was a drunk purchase, but I'm happy with it. Resident Evil 4 is awesome on it. Can't play for very long (maybe an hour or two)c, as it kinda ruptures my disposition but I don't like to play video games for much longer anyway.

one_reviews_text: General opinion: more than satisfiedNegative:- glasses fog up (sometimes)- small screen resolution: the pixels are small, but they are still visible. Need: 2x the resolution- there is no eye tracking function, which is important to create the right focus on the image and for comfort.- if you learn something you need use information for real notices. It is not comfortable.  Transperent mode is bad now, but it's working.- there are few settings and apps yet.Positive:- changing the distance to the text is useful for the eyes- it's a good way to make ideal work environment. You can control visual and auditory stimuli. You can do an ideal room.✅- helm don't allow wrinkle your forehead. It's interesting)- you can use it to get rid your social phobias.✅- there are a lot of experimental function: hand tracking, second transperent mode with augumented reality, attaching mouse, mode with increased frame rate.Need addition tools:Bluetooth keyboard, comfortable helm mountThank you, guys!

review_title: Low screen resolution: the pixels are small, but they are still visible.

one_reviews_text: I should have done more reasearch on this item, as it is the most inexpensive VR headset it was an attractive buy, however what they don't explicitly tell you is that you need a Facebook account just to open it.  I bought this for my son to use with video games and as he is a child, I was not about to get a facebook account for him to use it.  I also do not have a facebook account as i do not condone spying and collecting personal data.  If I had known the device would be dead in the water without a Facebook account I would not have bought it in the first place.  Buyer beware, the thing collects video feeds of your surroundings and your audio and stores them at facebook (meta). interestingly, they say they have one that doesne't need the account if you pay them an extra $500!!! suspicious.....
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 7 April 2022
review_title: You need a Facebook account to use this device

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest, it's not bad at all it just isn't what i expected. I could care less about the facebook mandatory connection at all. What I do care about is it's quality. I think the resolution of the product is below average. It is just blurry and I did try the 75 hertz setting but it still sucks. I get way to dizzy after each use and I would feel like puking after even just watching one YouTube video. It also hurts around my head and gives me a headache after I use it. Some games look nice. But some games also lag really badly which I resent. I feel like the games are choppy and get really boring really quickly. I returned it but I haven't got my money back so let's see where that gets me. I'd give the product a 4/10. It just isn't what I hoped for.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 9 January 2022
review_title: If you want to try a step into the future get it

one_reviews_text: My son got one and I fell in love and had to order one myself. I get extremely motion sick and there is many things I can do on it that does not make me nauseous. When you order your headset I would separately order a different face covering. Definitely worth the money!

one_reviews_text: The Headset is a great package for a wonderful VR experience, but a few minor issues put it off a bit for me. Personally, The head strap is a bit odd and doesn't provide a very comfortable experience when playing for long, but some cheap aftermarket accessories can fix that. Additionally, the store is a bit overpriced with some very lenient sales so I personally stuck with steam and the use of air link. Now, Airlink is a great software functionality, it just has many issues such as a weird wide FOV when looking through passthrough as well as plenty of visual glitches and some settings options that are impossible to change. But besides all of my messy criticism, it is a great head seat that will please most and is definitely a great VR experience.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 2 December 2021
review_title: Awesome Headset, just some minor issues

one_reviews_text: So I bought this for my wife for Christmas, she loves it, it's great for VR Chat and other games.My main complaint, and if you are considering this for PC, definitely check to see if your GPU is supported by oculus. I wish I would have known that it wasn't compatible with the 1650 GPUs, which is weird considering they support the 1060 gou and I believe a few 900 series GPUs.But any way, she really wanted to play her steam games in VR on her computer, but sadly she can not do that.But it runs great as a stand alone unit, and for what apps you can get in the Oculus store, and she still enjoys it.

one_reviews_text: Winter is coming and I'm old (let's just say I was alive for the Moon landing). So no snow skiing for me. This has games that are very easily paced (putt putt, rollercoaster, fishing etc) that boomers like me can appreciate. But don't get me wrong. It is TOTALLY immersive! If I only spend a couple of hours a week on it they are an amazing experience. Solo or with others from around the world. Get hip with this thing, grey hairs. It's fun!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 6 November 2021

one_reviews_text: The Oculus Quest 2 is a revolutionary device that brings VR to the mass market. The competitive pricing plus a wide variety of apps on the oculus store makes Quest2 an all-in-one entertainment powerhouse. However, the device is not well designed for spectacle wearers. Even with the eyeglass spacer provided, it is a pain to fit the eyeglasses into the small headset, not to mention that my eyeglasses keep nudging my nose, making the VR experience very uncomfortable. Fortunately, I bought from VR WAVE a pair of Quest 2 prescription lenses insert which completely solves the problem. I ordered them on the VR WAVE website and the lenses are delivered in a week. VR WAVE tailor made prescription lenses inserts according to my eyes, and the lenses inserts can be attached easily onto the headset with the magnetic design. I no longer have to wear eyeglasses into VR and being “perfect vision” in VR brings the whole experience to another level. I think that Oculus can do better on the headset design as VR is still far from comfortable without the help of these accessories.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 January 2022
review_title: Next gen console but with a catch

one_reviews_text: I purchased the Oculus for my 10 year old daughter for Christmas. It's now February 28th and she's lost 14 pounds. She plays it constantly as it is too nasty outside to stay out too long. She breaks a sweat about 5 min into play time.

one_reviews_text: My son and I both got one if these. After not much time, a month or 2 - the Operating System freezes, crashes, network won’t start, games won’t load, and then randomly it works again for maybe one or two sessions. We have factory reset our headsets twice and that did nothing but lose progress in my games. He can’t even play now because he is locked out his Facebook account (hacked)that he created for the Occulus and Occulus support won’t help him and there is no Facebook support. We are having to go to the Better Business Bureau to get refunds for his purchases or get a Facebook to verify his identity.  But it is fun when it works but lately, everytime I try to play I spend 20 minutes just powering down and restarting the headset until it works or I get frustrated.  I only have 3 games installed instead of all the games I had bough but that too doesn’t help.  Buyer beware, great technology but extremely buggy and if something happens to your Facebook account you will lose ALL of the games you have purchased.

one_reviews_text: The Meta Quest is exactly what my title implies. It's exciting when you first get set up and go into your first VR experience. In my case, "First Steps". And after playing different genres from Population 1, Cards&Tankards, and Trover Saves the Universe..VR and specifically The Quest 2 is primed to blow up in popularity very soon. The "Future" of gaming does comes with some con's though...battery life out of the box leaves a lot to be desired (2 hours of play time), do not expect graphics to blow you away, VR gaming is still relatively new. But seamlessly being able to party up and play video games in this VR viewpoint with friends is where this really shines. If you're a gamer, and haven't bought one yet, you are sorely missing out on a corner of gaming that is slowly becoming a must-have for gamers and casuals alike. Buy one now!

one_reviews_text: I tried a friend's pair before buying these, and they work just like I had hoped. All of the Oculus apps and games run smoothly over wifi even in an apartment. However, make sure you buy the cord to connect to your pc for if you plan on playing SteamVR games. My experience is because I live around others (i.e., I live in an apartment) and I am running my pc on wifi with the Oculus on wifi at the same time; running both on wifi is unmanagable due to sever lag and locking up completely. However, pc on wifi with oculus on cable works just fine with moments of barely noticeable delay. Also, consider getting a more comfortable head strap with an extra battery pack if you plan on playing longer than 2 hours per session.

If you hate Facebook, there is Oculess, but I'm ok with it and don't care that much.For Russians and other europeans, buying an adapter from American type plug is VITAL, because you just wouldn't able to charge the headset.In conclusion, I think it's the best headset on the market so far, consider buying it, if you want to get into the VR world as a newcomer.

Frequently loses tracking and requires constant resetting of guardian.  Cannot transfer stored files to PC or other storage media, even when connected to PC.

one_reviews_text: We were skeptical about this since it doesn’t hook to a computer like the one my oldest so has, but we didn’t want to sink the money into a computer powerful enough to run that Oculus  for my 14 year old. one_reviews_text: This headset seems like nice hardware but requires a facebook account to use.  I never made one before, so I did from the oculus app today only to immediately have it locked (before entering any profile information!)Currently this headset is $300 of useless plastic garbage, and unless facebook gets this sorted out in the next few days I will be returning this.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 3 November 2021

one_reviews_text: This product said that it would be shipped in a new condition but I can say with 100% confidence that it was not new. The box it came it said "Oculus Quest 2" which wasn't too surprising at first but then I realized that at the time of me buying the product that it should've said "Meta Quest 2" instead. Also when I opened the box one of the controllers had a smudge on the top of it. And after less than a month of me buying the product it just breaks, every time I turn it one the entire screen turns into whatever color the majority of the screen is making it almost impossible to play anything. I did not drop it or hit it on anything and made sure to take extra good care of it since this was one of my most expensive purchases.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 1 May 2022

one_reviews_text: I've had the GO, the Quest 1 and now this. This is pretty amazing. The resolution looks great. As everyone else has said the stock headstrap is pretty cheap so I got the Elite headstrap. Ping Pong is amazing in VR.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 12 October 2021

one_reviews_text: I bought the Oculus Quest 2 a while back. I sold it, regretted selling it, and bought it again. This thing is just too much fun. It's like having a portable arcade. The graphics are great when you consider it's a portable VR system, the sound is great and they continuously update the software for the device to include new features.PROS- Great graphics- Fun games- Fully wireless- Great for fun workoutsCONS- May cause motion sickness (as with any VR headset)
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 October 2021
review_title: Bought it, sold it, and re-bought it!

one_reviews_text: Definitely not for people who are prone to headaches or migraines. My son loves it although it has a very poor selection of games. If you are thinking about getting one hopefully you own a pc or android so you can download sidequest or applab and get more games. Highly suggest looking into games and apps outside of oculus store.

one_reviews_text: I am completely in love with this thing. I use it only for workouts, really, and I'm addicted. I can't wait to work out every day. review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 24 February 2022
review_title: This is the best thing ever

one_reviews_text: We have stupid and strange rules in Ukraine about packages. I don't know how it works but I had to pay 25% more for the Quest 2 for getting it (around $75). I was shocked because I have never paid that 25% before when I order import goods. I wanted to request a refund but Amazon decided to help me and they paid that 25% instead of me. I appreciate it. The Headset is awesome. Anyway you have to buy a good wifi 6 router for around $100 and some accessories like swords for Beat Saber, another strap, etc. So get ready to pay more than $300. Btw at first I wanted to play using Oculus Link but my AsRock z370 Extreme 4 motherboard doesn't have any type-c drivers lol. After that I decided to buy a wifi 6 router and I wasn't disappointed. Air Link has an awesome quality and low latency. Thank you Amazon for the Headset and help.
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 29 November 2021
review_title: My first order and VR experience

one_reviews_text: This is second breath after my PSVR. Very useful that it can be standalone and great to play with no wires. Will work something around two hours with no charge, which is pretty solid (considering my avg session time 1:30-2:00).Very recommended to buy a halo strap as helmet does not distribute weight on your head in the best way.The only thing I didn't like is that silicon mask cover is a bit bigger that it should be and there is folds  because of it. Anyway it doesn't bother me physically. Just need to place it correctly sometimes before wearing.

I tried the Quest 2 as standalone, then using AirLink, and lastly using a Cable.I think the Rift S is a better product, just works. If you are going to use the Quest 2 as a standalone is a great great product, but if you want to replace your PC VR, is not.For me, it's a 6.5/10 but if you are new, this could be a 9/10

one_reviews_text: Frustrating out of the box experience. It would try to boot up but crash and read No command with a little green man on his back with his chest open.  Software glitch on start up had me spending an hour online looking how to get this thing into a set up mode so I could factory rest it. I was 2 seconds away from returning it when it rebooted and actually powered on. I’ll update this if the user experience is extra special but so far I’m just frustrated with a mild headache. Now I wait for it to update..Following day, apart from the set up frustration and very slow updating the headset is something special.  Can’t wait to actually try out the apps and stuff but for now it’s working and kinda cool.

one_reviews_text: There are so many different things you can do on an Oculus. I love all the worlds you can explore and become fully submerged in. I gave it four stars because when I wear it for more than about five minutes, I start to get a headache, but I’m sure they’re working on making the next gen of Oculus lighter and more user-friendly. Otherwise, this device is so fun and totally worth the price!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 23 April 2022

one_reviews_text: Quest 2 is absolutely amazing! At $300, the 128gb version is a steal for the quality hardware, huge App Store & excellent performance. There’s really no need to buy the 256gb version or any of the accessories. Sure, the games cost extra but there are tons of free games available if you dig!Get off the couch & move around while you game! Several games easily trick you into working out without you even being aware of it… until you’re sweating & winded!No, it’s not the best but the current king of vr, the Valve Index, requires an extremely powerful gaming pc to plug into and is over $1200 just for the hardware. Quest 2 is nearly as good, has an App Store & is standalone (wireless.) Easy choice!
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 4 January 2022
review_title: The best vr option for the price. No question!

one_reviews_text: Estar inmerso con estas gafas VR son una experiencia única.  La versatilidad, aplicaciones de todo tipo y si sumamos la conectividad con la PC por Oculus Airlink, cable Link, Virtual Desktop, etc., hacen de este dispositivo una joya en el mundo de realidad  virtual.

one_reviews_text: Upon unboxing this item, the screen didn’t work. You could only see about an inch of the display and the rest was complete static. I’m guessing this user returned the item because of the static issue, and Amazon turned around and resold it to me. I’m shipping this back but it will take close to 2 weeks to receive a replacement. Completely ridiculous!

SuperNatural  does require a monthly subscription, but it is much less than a monthly fitness club payment that I probably would only use a couple times a week.

one_reviews_text: If you're going for a VR headset for pc play, get the HTC Vive; it's more expensive, but it is worth every penny compared to the Quest 2.Facebook(Meta) had the big brained idea of making the link cable port the same as the charging port. Normally this wouldn't be too bad, but the cable that is used is a usb c, a connector that can barely grab into the headset while in use.Functionality, it is far worse than previous oculus headsets (poor controller tracking, front sensors, ect) The only upside to the Quest 2 over say the Rift S, is it's weight; it is far lighter than other headsets. But that is a foot note compared to my problems with the Quest 2

HAHAHA it’s been another 16 DAYS since they’ve told me they will send a new headset and I should get the shipping tracking number “shortly” what a scam. Feels like they “stole” my headset. Not sure why it supposed to be so bad sending a new headset as replacement after confirming it was bad.Worst experience I’ve ever had.

one_reviews_text: Great for wireless PCVR as well as the standalone games from oculus. 2 weeks later the right controller started to drift, have to use contact cleaner to fix it. Air link works great, though i had to get a new wifi router (MUST be wifi 6, with high bandwidth). Link cable does look sharper though but the cable is annoying and for most games the wireless is better. It has decent resolution that is very clear (no grid/screen effect). Battery lasts for about 2 hours, with a powerbank attached It goes for way more, ~ 6 hours.Been playing both native and PCVR games and loving it, just the controller drift was annoying
review_date: Reviewed in the United States on 20 March 2022

one_reviews_text: Me and my husband have been wanting this product for a while and finally decided to purchase it and WE COULDN'T BE HAPPIER!! It has so many different games and apps and virtual worlds . It’s super amazing and a GREAT GIFT BUY

This one comes with a short charger that you can’t play with and a not high quality case. The new headset also comes with a Velcro’s strap fully unlike the plastic quest 1 strap. If you're going to buy one though just make sure you also get at least a 10-16ft usb C charge cable for long plug as you play sessions, and a different premium head strap for better comfort. And for glasses wearers like myself prescription VR lens from somewhere like VR Wave are the best investment, trust me.
